alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 24 at 8:28AM MDT until October 25 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Flash freeze on roadways. Blowing Snow at Marias Pass with northeast winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph will reduce visibility to less than one quarter mile at times. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches, except up to 6 inches at Marias Pass. * WHERE...West Glacier Region. * WHEN...From noon today to noon MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
